intro: Pedicularis crenata subsp. crenatiformis, commonly known as the wavy betony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with wavy margins. Its flowers are typically pink to purple, with two upper lips and three lower lips, forming a distinctive spurred shape. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
